revised_title: Cirrothauma murrayi: A Unique Finned Octopod
tldr: The article describes the unique features and anatomy of the finned octopod, Cirrothauma murrayi, which lives in deep-sea environments. The octopod has a gelatinous body, large fins, and a medusoid form that allows it to hover in the water column. The author discusses the animal's habitat, distribution, and its evolutionary position among other cephalopods.
scientific_discipline: Biology and Life Sciences > Cephalopod Biology
